author: victorycompany243
title: My Identity
description: In DRC, more than 160,000 teachers work hard but very often are not on the list of state employees, which causes several disorders (corruption) in the Congolese education system and unbalances

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge effectively, it would bring education services in the Democratic Republic of Congo to the blockchain era and provide teachers with decentralized digital identities. It has the potential to lead to solving corruption issues, bring better data management and ultimately bring more fairness to every beneficiaries. I feel the proposer has therefore provided a clear and concise description of the issues in their Problem Statement. If successful, the proposal will have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem with the on-boarding of teachers in RDC. The project however is lacking KPIs to track the progress of the proposal and its success. I therefore rate Impact a note of 3/5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The website victorycompany.net is at the time of this assessment, under maintenance which is not a good start. Many of the fields of this proposal have not been filled properly and are simply empty if not incomplete. Finally, out of a team of 5, there are 2 Electronic technician and 1 accountant. There is no expert in digital identity, no teacher or education expert. The proposer did not give a clear account of what skill sets will be necessary to deliver on the proposal. Beyond the website, the proposer did not provide evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience from the team members needed to implement the proposal.

The budget presentation is nonexistent, so is the timeline, roadmap and key milestones. This is why this proposal gets 1/5 in feasibility. Given the experience and plan presented it is highly unlikely that his proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The audit fields have not been filled so there is not much to comment. I therefore rate auditability a 1/5, if the team is unable to fill the proposal requirements properly, I have little confidence that we'll be able to track the progress and success of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea of digital identity for teachers as a way to fight corruption in DRC aligns with the basis of the Grow Africa, Grow Cardano challenge by offering solutions to address educational concerns, onboarding users, and providing a utility to a potentially large user base (government and specifically teachers).

The stated risks of government refusal, that is investing in a project aimed at overcoming resistance to fixing corruption, should not discourage investment in an attempt to better the environment and pursue equitable development - especially as it is related to our educators and youth.  However the lack of resources comment is bit distracting, since the proposal originates from an IT company with a sole purpose of raising funds for an (presumably) existing team to deliver a solution to this problem.

The overall idea is valid, however my neutral position stems from the author's inability to provide a clear description of the solution, or methodologies for overcoming risks to the project's success.
f6_assessments.q1:
Timeline and milestones for delivery of this project are not present.  A budget breakdown for the use of 15k USD funds is also not present.

A description of the My Identity team, presumably members of the existing Victory Company Team, are listed, however no details about their experience or qualifications are provided other than job functions.  The website also consists of a single page, linking to a facebook page for Victory Company, containing some details on the company's background and activities over the past 2 years.

Perhaps my greatest concern with this proposal is that it does not provide a detailed description of the commercial model, giving us limited insight into the revenue/business model that could drive sustainable success.  Is it a non-profit initiative?  A donation?  Or is it a fee-generating business that taps into the payroll systems?
f6_assessments.q2:
The author of this proposal has not provided any vision for success of this project in the auditability section.  In the absence of metrics to track this project's successes, it is left to the readers imagination to determine whether the team has not thought of the end goal or simply isn't sure at this stage whether or not the project can be sold and then implemented to benefit the relevant partners.

It's not even clear from the proposal whether it is a continuation of a previously funded project or a new one.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposer is addressing a challenge in the education sector in the DRC. This is specially for those in the government sector. The proposer believes that there are inefficiencies and corruption in the education sector. The project named My Identity is what the proposer and his team think will help solve the problem in DRC, Corruption is one thing that does not enhance development and in the education sector where most of the teachers do not have their salaries pass through the right channel, most government authorities syphoned the money and do not pay teachers their due salaries. When this App is introduced in DRC, it will help bring transparency and help curb corruption, However the proposer thinks that this app will explain things well for teachers in the Cardano ecosystem. The value it will add to the community is that every government sector teacher can monitor their inflows regularly. Since the Cardano community is a digital world, the impact will be great because there will be a reduction in inefficiencies (corruption 
windows, interoperability issues, uncertainty and complexity).
However i disagree with the KPIs used in this proposal. Largely government officials who benefit from this old system will make it difficult to make the My Identity project materialize therefore making it address this challenge even in the future.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has a company named Victory Company which runs the My Identity project. The company designs a digital technologies which they think solves most of these problems from teachers. The company consist of 6 people and with their experience and background, they feel designing this app will help curb the problem. Even though the proposer provided links and word documents to back  and to implement the proposal, those link does not say much about what and how they intend to implement it. The proposers are a team members of 6 with various background. The proposer provided names and field of each one of them;
ESPOIR BARAKA : Web developer
BELLA KAMBAY : Electronic technician
BORA UZIMA : Accountant
AKILIMALI CHIZUNGU : Mobile Developer
VICTOIRE SHUKURU : Web Developer
MIRIAM RUKIRANDE : Electronic technician
This comes with a budget of USD 15000 which looks feasible but they will still come for more funds because public school teachers across DRC that must be paid well will need more funds and also for administrative purposes.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer did not give a time frame that this My Identity project will take to materialize. Because of bureaucratic nature of government programs, this can take a very long time before government will give approval for projects like this. The KPIs are not much detailed in this proposal and with the method that the proposer wants to use, it will take a long time before this is achieved. This project can be successful provided detailed training and awareness is created so that every teacher and those in charge understand the My Identity project very well. The Community can track the progress of this project because it is digital and everyone can access it even or without internet connection.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies a problem within the challenge that needs to be solved, but the proposal has not clearly articulated how it is going to solve the identified problem with clarity, therefore, I rate this proposal 3 stars in this department as the details given are not clear enough to effectively determine if the proposal effectively addresses the challenge. I'd suggest the proposer provide more details about how the implementation of the proposal will be.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not provide a detailed plan to effectively assess how the completion of the proposal is going to take place. The team members' names are given but no further details were given. Due to the factors previously mentioned I rate this department 2 stars out of 5. I'd highly suggest the proposer give more details on the plan and solution description and LinkedIn links for the proposing team in order to show that the proposal is more feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: No information at all is given about how to audit the proposal. I highly suggest the proposer give information on how to audit the proposal as this information is highly necessary for voters to trust the promises are going to be fulfilled

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal explains what problem they intend solving but how exactly they intend solving it is not well stated, the project also tallies with the challenge settings. To Embark on such a project that involves the state directly, it should have been stated as to the first step they will take to see to the implementation of this project and who they will have to meet. For example, they would have to see the minister of education as so on. And also the problem stated here says that teachers names are not on the list of state employees which means those teachers whose names are not on the state list do not get paid. They further went on to  propose that , there should be an education  digitalized system, which the very first issue to be solved here is to make sure every teacher’s name appears on the state employees list before digitalization can set in to ensure everyone is on the same pace else, even after the digitalization, some teachers names will still not appear on the list if the measures are not put in place to first make sure every teachers name appears. The proposal does not  articulates a plan for the project’s future sustainability.
f6_assessments.q1: Since they have experience in terms of web development and mobile app development and  accounting , it would have  been  very possible to digitalizatize the education system in the Democratic Republic of Congo but then the implementation plan as I stated earlier does not explain how they will come about it. Again they were expected to give a breakdown of the budget which they did not, they only stated that they needed $15000 to begin but did not  give a breakdown of how they intend spending this money, which to me disqualifies their proposal. The exact number of team member with the proportion of female and males with their experiences were stated.Lastly, they also they left out the  portion of timelines, resources necessary to implement the proposal like Human Resources, raw material, technology, which means that it will be impossible to track how effectively they are executing their project if given the funds and  I doubt any investor would invest in such a proposal . They did not also consider the risks and challenges involved in executing this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is absolutely not sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal because first of all, how to track the progress and measure the success of this project was left blank, also the sustainable development goal rating was not provided either.  Moreover roadmaps with milestones , metrics to measure project’s success, nor clear understandable description of the targeted problem to measure against outcomes were stated. A proposal without how they intend tracking their progress makes the proposal incomplete since is it one of the vital information the investor will be watching out for. No investor will spend his money on a project which he doesn’t know whether or not it will fail or succeed. Stating the sustainable development goal of ones project adds more spice and clarity of ones proposal so therefore not stating it like “My identity”did makes it invalid and worth not investing
